oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Framed effects of Pvt. John L. Sullivan
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Framed effects related to Pvt. John L. Sullivan, Co. H, 28th Inf. Regt., 1st Div., American Expeditionary Forces. Included are" a letter recognizing an award of the Distinguished Service Cross (DSC), a photograph of Sullivan, and two medals. The first is the original DSC; the second is an Italian medal, possibly the Cross for War Merit. Sullivan received the DSC for "extraordinary heroism in action" It is said that he crawled into "No Man's Land" after hearing cries of the wounded.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Sullivan, John L.
World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
